text: William Nyallau Badak (born 22 July 1951) is a Malaysian politician. He is the Member of the Parliament of Malaysia for the Lubok Antu constituency in Sarawak, representing the Parti Rakyat Sarawak (PRS) in the governing Barisan Nasional coalition. He was elected to Parliament in the 2008 election, replacing long-serving incumbent Jawah Gerang as PRS's nominee for the Lubok Antu seat. Before entering Parliament, he was a Native Court judge. Presently he is a member of Parti Sarawak Bersatu (PSB), after he was sacked from PRS of Barisan Nasional on 22 April 2018 and dropped as candidate in the 2018 election. ==Election results== {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em ; font-size:95%" |+ Parliament of Malaysia: Lubok Antu, Sarawak Percentage figures based on total turnout. !|Year !colspan=2|Government !|Votes !|Pct !colspan=2|Opposition !|Votes !|Pct |- |2008 | | | (PRS) |align="right" |6,769 |56% | | |Nicholas Bawin Anggat (IND) |align="right" |5,159 |43% |- |2013 | | | (PRS) |align="right" |8,278 |55% | | |Larry Soon @ Larry Sng Wei Shien (SWP) |align="right" |4,187 |27% |} ==References== Category:Living people Category:1951 births Category:People from Sarawak Category:Parti Rakyat Sarawak politicians Category:Members of the Dewan Rakyat
